moves.1. e4: I always start with e4, its a weakness of me ...
moves.1... c5 2. c3: Nf3 is the normal answer, or Nc3 (closed variation). This move gives faster an open center.
moves.2... e6 3. d4 d5 4. exd5 Qxd5: Too soon to come out with the Queen. e x d5 was better
moves.5. Nf3 Nf6 6. Na3 cxd4: Why ?? Black should develop. Be7 or Nc6. Also to consider is retrieving the Queen and accepting the tempo loss with Qd8
moves.7. Nb5: I am forcing the black Knight to the side
moves.7... Na6 8. Qxd4: I want to avoid that e5 is played and i want to keep the center.
moves.8... Bc5: Good move! Now i have to take position
moves.9. Qxd5 exd5: I would have taken with the Knight. The d-pawn stands not connected and is weak.
moves.10. Be2 O-O 11. O-O Bg4: Good move. Re8 was also good
moves.12. a4 Rfe8: Good! Forcing me into tempo loss
moves.13. Bd1 Rad8: Difficult choice. Not a bad move, but without spirit. I would have played Bd7 or h6
moves.14. Bg5 Bxf3: No, not good. You activate my Bishop.
moves.16. Rfd1: I start to put pressure on the weak pawn.
moves.16... Rde8: I know that theory would advise to take the open line ...but you are ruining your pawn position
moves.17. Bxf6 gxf6: I mentioned this already. You hang on to that open line, but you cannot accomplish anything with this line for the moment
moves.19... Re6e5 20. Bxb7: Loosing more material. Actually the game is already over now.
moves.20... Nb8 21. f4: Making room for the Bishop on f3 whilst gaining a tempo
moves.21... Re5e7 22. Bf3 a6 23. Nd6: Coming to the King side and luring to f6 pawn
moves.23... Rd8 24. Ne4: Never exchange pieces when you are behind in material. Its lost but why not Rc8
moves.29. Rxd7 Rxd7 30. Nf6+ Kg7 31. Nxd7 Bd6: I secure the King side and will go to promote a pawn on Q side.
moves.32... a5 33. bxa5: a pawn cannot be stopped. Game over.
